ticket.title: config.gem with multiple sources
ticket.original-body: The gem command allows you to specific N sources but GemDependency only allows one. To install some gems (e.g. aslakhellesoy-cucumber from github) you need to specify multiple gem repositories, such as gems.github.com and gems.rubyforge.org. The attached patch adds a `:sources` option to specify multiple sources. I toyed with making `:source` and `:sources` accept either single or array values and making them equivalent but thought this was best. I purposefully did not document this in the environment config template as I figure it's too uncommon, though happy to be convinced otherwise. RDoc would be nice. e.g. of usage: config.gem "aslakhellesoy-cucumber", :sources => ["http://gems.github.com", "http://gems.rubyforge.org"]
ticket.latest-body: The gem command allows you to specific N sources but GemDependency only allows one. To install some gems (e.g. aslakhellesoy-cucumber from github) you need to specify multiple gem repositories, such as gems.github.com and gems.rubyforge.org. The attached patch adds a `:sources` option to specify multiple sources. I toyed with making `:source` and `:sources` accept either single or array values and making them equivalent but thought this was best. I purposefully did not document this in the environment config template as I figure it's too uncommon, though happy to be convinced otherwise. RDoc would be nice. e.g. of usage: config.gem "aslakhellesoy-cucumber", :sources => ["http://gems.github.com", "http://gems.rubyforge.org"]
ticket.original-body-html:
The gem command allows you to specific N sources but GemDependency only allows one.

To install some gems (e.g. aslakhellesoy-cucumber from github) you need to specify multiple gem repositories, such as gems.github.com and gems.rubyforge.org.

The attached patch adds a :sources option to specify multiple sources.

I toyed with making :source and :sources accept either single or array values and making them equivalent but thought this was best.

I purposefully did not document this in the environment config template as I figure it's too uncommon, though happy to be convinced otherwise. RDoc would be nice.

e.g. of usage:

config.gem "aslakhellesoy-cucumber", :sources => ["http://gems.github.com", "http://gems.rubyforge.org"]

version.body:
The gem command allows you to specific N sources but GemDependency only allows one.
To install some gems (e.g. aslakhellesoy-cucumber from github) you need to specify multiple gem repositories, such as gems.github.com and gems.rubyforge.org.
The latest patch (see last comment) adds a `:sources` option to specify multiple sources and improves the `config.gem` rdoc.
version.body-html:
The gem command allows you to specific N sources but GemDependency only allows one.

To install some gems (e.g. aslakhellesoy-cucumber from github) you need to specify multiple gem repositories, such as gems.github.com and gems.rubyforge.org.

The latest patch (see last comment) adds a :sources option to specify multiple sources and improves the config.gem rdoc.
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body: +1, small change and a handy feature
version.body-html: +1, small change and a handy feature
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body: +1 Though the real solution is for either every gem developer to host their gems on Rubyforge, or (more realistically) Rubyforge provide automatic acceptances for name-spaced gems (ala Github).
version.body-html: +1 Though the real solution is for either every gem developer to host their gems on Rubyforge, or (more realistically) Rubyforge provide automatic acceptances for name-spaced gems (ala Github).
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body:
Just noticed `attr_accessor :source`. Not sure if anybody is using GemDependency directly, or whether it's a supported API.
I've attached a new patch which removes the `source` reader accessor and replaces it with `sources`.
Even more unsure now whether :source should simply be an alias to :sources and we allow both a single value and an array of values.
version.body-html:
Just noticed attr_accessor :source. Not sure if anybody is using GemDependency directly, or whether it's a supported API.

I've attached a new patch which removes the source reader accessor and replaces it with sources.

Even more unsure now whether :source should simply be an alias to :sources and we allow both a single value and an array of values.
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body:
Attached is a new ticket with updated rdoc for `config.gem`, as well as making `:source` and `:sources` equivalent and consistent.
The `Rails::GemDependency#source` accessor has been removed and replaced with `#sources`
version.body-html:
Attached is a new ticket with updated rdoc for config.gem, as well as making :source and :sources equivalent and consistent.

The Rails::GemDependency#source accessor has been removed and replaced with #sources
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body:
This is caused by the --source option to gem install ignoring any other sources configured by the system when installing dependencies. (see also [this ticket](http://rubyforge.org/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=21606&group_id=126&atid=575) for Rubygems)
A different fix would be to include the sources listed from 'gem sources' when invoking 'gem install'. That would solve the most common case (where a gem on github depends on gems hosted on rubyforge).
It should be easy to add ('gem sources' is basically just a newline-seperated list of URLs) - I'll try to put a patch together this weekend.
version.body-html:
This is caused by the --source option to gem install ignoring any other sources configured by the system when installing dependencies. (see also this ticket for Rubygems)

A different fix would be to include the sources listed from 'gem sources' when invoking 'gem install'. That would solve the most common case (where a gem on github depends on gems hosted on rubyforge).

It should be easy to add ('gem sources' is basically just a newline-seperated list of URLs) - I'll try to put a patch together this weekend.
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body: you think that's really a good idea though? Sounds like a round-about monkey patch to rubygems, something that would be in rails for quite a while. At least my approach is simply the same as what you'd do on the command line and when rubygems is fixed you just update your app's config (if needed)
version.body-html: you think that's really a good idea though? Sounds like a round-about monkey patch to rubygems, something that would be in rails for quite a while. At least my approach is simply the same as what you'd do on the command line and when rubygems is fixed you just update your app's config (if needed)
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body:
Is this what causes my gems:install to fail when installing a gem from GitHub (using :sources => "http://gems.github.com") that has a regular dependency?
gem install patientslikeme-campaign_monitor --source http://gems.github.com ERROR: Error installing patientslikeme-campaign_monitor: patientslikeme-campaign_monitor requires xml-simple (>= 1.0.11, runtime)
version.body-html:
Is this what causes my gems:install to fail when installing a gem from GitHub (using :sources => "http://gems.github.com") that has a regular dependency?

gem install patientslikeme-campaign_monitor --source http://gems.github.com ERROR: Error installing patientslikeme-campaign_monitor:

patientslikeme-campaign_monitor requires xml-simple (>= 1.0.11, runtime)
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body: Please reopen if still an issue.
version.tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.diffable-attributes: --- :tag: dependencies dependency gem gem.config gems patch railties :priority: 0
version.title: config.gem with multiple sources

version.body:
When Coach began as Manhattan Leather Bags in 1941, they were inspired by baseball glove design and they created discount handbags with similar qualities.supra shoes didn't come along until years later. The original handbag collection had twelve designs, and they were made from supple, tan, top-quality leathers, and showed the same excellent craftsmanship and stitching that we still expect today.

Coach hired a woman named Bonnie Cashin in 1962, and she brought new looks to Coach bags. She used many new fabrics and organic materials like jersey and wool. She created the brass hardware that is symbolic of timberland boots. When Lew Frankfort came aboard in 1979, he brought Coach to the next level, and they became a name known the world over. Affordable luxury was not a concept that many people knew, but now they would. Soon after Frankfort joined Coach, they came out with a catalog, and opened their flagship store in New York City.

In the 1980's, Coach expanded and made innovations that brought its brand relevance and strength. They designed watches starting in 1988, and also expanded their company to Tokyo. Japan still counts among the leading purchasers of coach purses and Coach heels. The manufacture of Coach shoes began in the mid 90's, and Reed Krakoff, the lead designer, loaned his talents to help put Coach heels and louis vuitton bags outlet on the map. Their shoes aren't as popular as their handbags, but they are well worth the money invested in their purchase.

Women love heels, but at times you may want to wear shoes that don't have this height. true religion jeans outlet are as dedicated to comfort as they are to style and pizzazz. Coach platforms come in many styles, from gold loafers to slingbacks with open toes. You may be able to find Coach shoes at discount prices online, but be sure that you are buying genuine Coach products.

If you're looking for moncler jackets that will make you feel and look glamorous, Coach shoes and chanel purses can do that well. Coach sneakers and heels will make you feel sporty, too. When selecting pumps or sandals to wear, you'll be happy to count on the long-standing quality and service of the Coach company. They have many styles to choose from, including chic and glamorous Coach boots and Coach heels. Whether you are looking for sports shoes like Coach sneakers or sexy shoes like Coach boots, the Coach name will never let you down.

version.body: A Replica Breitling is a timepiece of high quality and functionality and you will have all the class, prestige and luxury of a wealthy, successful individual. By choosing from our selection of luxury Replica Watches , you can improve your self-esteem and feel confident to enter new circles of business associates and friends. These Rolex Replicas will surely enhance your style and only you will know the watch you wear did not cost you $1,000's of dollars.
